comment.author: 15410137@N05
comment._content: My ancestor, Robert Thomson (Thomsons Bay) and large family lived here, having arrived in the Swan River Colony at the end of 1829 when Perth was founded. He died at Kangaroo Island, South Australia, while living with a son and his family there. The government reclaimed his entitlement to his land to make Rottnest Island a prison. Some Aboriginal prisoners stole his boat and escaped back to the mainland.
